title: (No. 2) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 130 of 2016) are amended, in Part C of the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Notification and Control of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Notification and Control of 
Diseases affecting Terrestrial Animals (No. 2) Regulations 2016 (Amendment) 
Regulations 2024.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited notification control disease affecting terrestrial animal (no 2) regulation 2016 (amendment) regulation 2024

title: (No. 2) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 130 of 2016) are amended, in Part C of the
heading: 2. The Notification and Control of Diseases affecting Terrestrial Animals
text_raw:
2. The Notification and Control of Diseases affecting Terrestrial Animals 
(No. 2) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 130 of 2016) are amended, in Part C of the 
Schedule, by the insertion— 

(a) 

before “Crimean Congo haemorrhagic fever” of “Caseous 
lymphadenitis”, and 

(b) before “Equine piroplasmosis” of “Duck viral enteritis”, and 

“Duck viral hepatitis”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

2 October, 2024. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 10th December, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [683] 3
text_norm: 2 notification control disease affecting terrestrial animal (no 2) regulation 2016 (s.i no 130 2016) amended part c schedule insertion-- (a) crimean congo haemorrhagic fever caseous lymphadenitis (b) equine piroplasmosis duck viral enteritis duck viral hepatitis  given official seal 2 october 2024 charlie mcconalogue minister agriculture food marine notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 10th december 2024 683 3

title: (No. 2) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 130 of 2016) are amended, in Part C of the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE. 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations make caseous lymphadenitis, duck viral enteritis and duck 
viral hepatitis notifiable diseases. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [683]
